name: dart-mirrors
comment:
Basic reflection in Dart, with support for introspection and dynamic evaluation.

Introspection is that subset of reflection by which a running program can examine its own structure. For example, a function that prints out the names of all the members of an arbitrary object.

Dynamic evaluation refers the ability to evaluate code that has not been literally specified at compile time, such as calling a method whose name is provided as an argument (because it is looked up in a database, or provided interactively by the user).

How to interpret this library's documentation

As a rule, the names of Dart declarations are represented using instances of class dart-core.Symbol. Whenever the doc speaks of an object s of class dart-core.Symbol denoting a name, it means the string that was used to construct s.

The documentation frequently abuses notation with Dart pseudo-code such as o.x(a), where o and a are defined to be objects; what is actually meant in these cases is o'.x(a') where o' and a' are Dart variables bound to o and a respectively. Furthermore, o' and a' are assumed to be fresh variables (meaning that they are distinct from any other variables in the program).

Sometimes the documentation refers to serializable objects. An object is serializable across isolates if and only if it is an instance of num, bool, String, a list of objects that are serializable across isolates, or a map with keys and values that are all serializable across isolates.

Status: Unstable

The dart:mirrors library is unstable and its API might change slightly as a result of user feedback. This library is platform dependent and therefore it has implementations for both dart2js and the Dart VM. Both are under development and may not support all operations yet.

reflectType.name: reflectType
reflectType.comment:
This function returns a dart-mirrors.TypeMirror reflecting the type represented by dart-mirrors.reflectType.key.

If dart-mirrors.reflectType.key is not an instance of dart-core.Type then this function throws an dart-core.ArgumentError.

Note that since one cannot obtain a dart-core.Type object from another isolate, this function can only be used to obtain type mirrors on types of the current isolate.

reflectClass.name: reflectClass
reflectClass.comment:
Reflects a class declaration. Let C be the original class declaration of the class represented by dart-mirrors.reflectClass.key. This function returns a dart-mirrors.ClassMirror reflecting C.

If dart-mirrors.reflectClass.key is not an instance of dart-core.Type then this function throws an dart-core.ArgumentError. If dart-mirrors.reflectClass.key is the Type for dynamic or a function typedef, throws an dart-core.ArgumentError.

Note that since one cannot obtain a dart-core.Type object from another isolate, this function can only be used to obtain class mirrors on classes of the current isolate.

reflect.name: reflect
reflect.comment:
Reflects an instance. Returns an dart-mirrors.InstanceMirror reflecting dart-mirrors.reflect.reflectee. If dart-mirrors.reflect.reflectee is a function or an instance of a class that has a call method, the returned instance mirror will be a dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror.

Note that since one cannot obtain an object from another isolate, this function can only be used to obtain mirrors on objects of the current isolate.

class.name: MirrorsUsed
class.preview: Annotation describing how "dart:mirrors" is used (EXPERIMENTAL).

class.name: Comment
class.preview: Class used for encoding comments as metadata annotations.

class.name: SourceLocation
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.SourceLocation describes the span of an entity in Dart source code.

class.name: ParameterMirror
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.ParameterMirror reflects a Dart formal parameter declaration.

class.name: VariableMirror
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.VariableMirror reflects a Dart language variable declaration.

class.name: MethodMirror
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.MethodMirror reflects a Dart language function, method, constructor, getter, or setter.

class.name: TypedefMirror
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.TypedefMirror represents a typedef in a Dart language program.

class.name: TypeVariableMirror
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.TypeVariableMirror represents a type parameter of a generic type.

class.name: FunctionTypeMirror
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.FunctionTypeMirror represents the type of a function in the Dart language.

class.name: ClassMirror
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.ClassMirror reflects a Dart language class.

class.name: TypeMirror
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.TypeMirror reflects a Dart language class, typedef, function type or type variable.

class.name: CombinatorMirror
class.preview: A mirror on a show/hide combinator declared on a library dependency.

class.name: LibraryDependencyMirror
class.preview: A mirror on an import or export declaration.

class.name: LibraryMirror
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.LibraryMirror reflects a Dart language library, providing access to the variables, functions, and classes of the library.

class.name: ClosureMirror
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.ClosureMirror reflects a closure.

class.name: InstanceMirror
class.preview: An dart-mirrors.InstanceMirror reflects an instance of a Dart language object.

class.name: ObjectMirror
class.preview: An dart-mirrors.ObjectMirror is a common superinterface of dart-mirrors.InstanceMirror, dart-mirrors.ClassMirror, and dart-mirrors.LibraryMirror that represents their shared functionality.

class.name: DeclarationMirror
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.DeclarationMirror reflects some entity declared in a Dart program.

class.name: IsolateMirror
class.preview: An dart-mirrors.IsolateMirror reflects an isolate.

class.name: Mirror
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.Mirror reflects some Dart language entity.

class.name: MirrorSystem
class.preview: A dart-mirrors.MirrorSystem is the main interface used to reflect on a set of associated libraries.
